intro: Johrenia golestanica, commonly known as the Golestan johrenia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Golestan Province in Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh conditions. Its foliage is aromatic, and it produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Johrenia golestanica is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
